news.title: Sanctioned spyware maker Intellexa had direct access to government espionage victims, researchers say
news.summary: Based on a leaked video, security researchers alleged that Intellexa staffers have remote live access to their customers' surveillance systems, allowing them to see hacking targets’ personal data.

news.title: Amazon’s new Kindle Scribe and Kindle Scribe Colorsoft launch on December 10
news.summary: The new Kindle Scribe has a larger 11-inch glare-free display, is just 5.4 mm thick, and weighs only 400 g. It’s also 40% faster when writing or turning pages.

news.title: California’s ban on self-driving trucks could soon be over
news.summary: Revised rules in California would allow self-driving trucks to test on public highways. The rules also close a loophole allowing police to issue tickets for driverless vehicles.

news.title: Why Day One Ventures’ Masha Bucher thinks VCs and storytelling go hand-in-hand
news.summary: Day One Ventures' Masha Bucher doesn't just invest in startups — she also tells their stories. Her integrated model aligns incentives and proves conviction matters more than contracts.

news.title: Meta centralizes Facebook and Instagram support, tests AI support assistant
news.summary: The new support hub will connect users to security tools, account recovery options, and an AI assistant.

news.title: Amazon is reportedly ready to drop its USPS deal if negotiations fall through
news.summary: After over 30 years, Amazon may be cutting ties with the United States Postal Service as it looks to expand its own delivery network, as reported by The Washington Post. news.title: Amazon’s new color Kindle Scribe launches on December 10th
news.summary: Amazon has finally given a release date for its new Kindle Scribe Colorsoft and Kindle Scribe: They’ll be available to purchase starting on December 10th, Amazon spokesperson Rachel Erickson tells The Verge. They’ll cost the same as what Amazon announced back in September: $629.99 for the Colorsoft

news.title: Spotify wants to be the next big video service
news.summary: This is Lowpass by Janko Roettgers, a newsletter on the ever-evolving intersection of tech and entertainment, syndicated just for The Verge subscribers once a week. Get ready for a lot more video content on Spotify. Sometime later this month, the service will start incorporating music videos into it

news.title: AI chatbots can be wooed into crimes with poetry
news.summary: It turns out my parents were wrong. Saying "please" doesn't get you what you want-poetry does. At least, it does if you're talking to an AI chatbot. news.title: OnePlus 15 launches US preorders after delayed FCC clearance
news.summary: OnePlus has launched its delayed US preorders for the flagship OnePlus 15, almost a month after the phone was revealed. news.title: In 1995, a Netscape employee wrote a hack in 10 days that now runs the Internet
news.summary: Thirty years later, JavaScript is the glue that holds the interactive web together, warts and all.

news.title: Welcome to “necroprinting”—3D printer nozzle made from mosquito’s proboscis
news.summary: They're quite a bit cheaper than manufactured nozzles if you can dissect them.

news.summary: Even the first Trump administration had tougher fuel economy targets.

news.title: Lego announces NASA Artemis SLS rocket set to lift off (literally) in 2026

news.title: A New Anonymous Phone Carrier Lets You Sign Up With Nothing but a Zip Code
news.summary: Privacy stalwart Nicholas Merrill spent a decade fighting an FBI surveillance order. Now he wants to sell you phone service—without knowing almost anything about you.

news.title: ByteDance and DeepSeek Are Placing Very Different AI Bets
news.summary: The diverging path of China’s two leading AI players shows where the country’s artificial intelligence industry is headed.
